Therapeutic Goods (Exemption) Order 2015

I make the following order under section 22(4) of the Therapeutic Goods Act 2001 .

13 July 2015

MICHAEL DARREL JOSEPH FERGUSON

Minister for Health

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Therapeutic Goods (Exemption) Order 2015 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
        (1) In this order â€“
            authorised premises means premises at which the supply of needles and syringes by way of a dispensing machine is authorised under a permit issued and in force under Division 1A of Part 3 of the Public Health Act 1997 ;
            dispensing machine has the same meaning as in section 56A of the Public Health Act 1997 .
        (2) The Acts Interpretation Act 1931 applies to the interpretation of this order as if it were by-laws.

4. Exemptions
        (1) A person is exempt from the operation of section 22(1) of the Therapeutic Goods Act 2001 in respect of the following:
                (a) the installation of a dispensing machine, if the person is installing the dispensing machine on authorised premises;
                (b) the supply of needles or syringes by means of a dispensing machine installed on authorised premises.
        (2) A person who occupies or controls authorised premises is exempt from the operation of section 22(2) of the Therapeutic Goods Act 2001 in respect of the following:
                (a) the installation of a dispensing machine on the premises;
                (b) the storage of needles or syringes in a dispensing machine installed on the premises;
                (c) the supply of needles or syringes by means of a dispensing machine installed on the premises.

5. Legislation revoked
    The legislation specified in Schedule 1 is revoked.

SCHEDULE 1 - Legislation revoked
